intro: Crepis tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to extreme conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Crepis tibetica is known for its resilience and is often found in alpine meadows at elevations above 3,000 meters.
